description: This file is a Node.js script acting as a development environment shim for Create React App (CRA). It maps CLI flags (--port, --host) to environment variables (PORT, HOST) to initiate the React development server with custom host and port configurations, ensuring cross-platform compatibility.

methods.name: parseArgs(argv)
methods.description: Parses command-line arguments, extracting port and host options and passthrough arguments.

methods.name: main()
methods.description: Main execution function that sets environment variables based on parsed args and spawns the React start process.

ctags.name: host
ctags.pattern: /^  const result = { port: undefined, host: undefined, passthrough: [] };$/

ctags.name: passthrough
ctags.pattern: /^  const result = { port: undefined, host: undefined, passthrough: [] };$/

ctags.name: port
ctags.pattern: /^  const result = { port: undefined, host: undefined, passthrough: [] };$/

ctags.name: result
ctags.pattern: /^  const result = { port: undefined, host: undefined, passthrough: [] };$/

fields.name: const result = { port: undefined, host: undefined, passthrough: [] };
